com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.dialogs.menu

Interface MenuPresenter.MenuView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSwingMainMenuView, ContextMenuDialog, ContextMenuDialog, MainMenuToolbarViewSwingAdapter, MainMenuToolbarViewSwtAdapter, MainMenuViewSwingAdapter, MainMenuViewSwtAdapter
    Enclosing class:
    MenuPresenter

    public static interface MenuPresenter.MenuView
    The MenuPresenter.MenuView is used to display a main menu or tool bar. You could implement your own MenuPresenter.MenuView or use the existing SWT or Swing implementation.
    See:
  • GuiSwingFactory.createMenuAdapter()
  • GuiSwingFactory.createToolbarAdapter()
  • GuiSwtFactory.createMenuAdapter()
  • GuiSwtFactory.GuiSwingFactory.
    Note: instead of implementing this view you also could use GuiCoontroller.createToolbarCommandList() or GuiCoontroller.createMainMenuCommandList()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCommand(Command command)
      This method will be called once for each command at present method in GuiController.
      void addSeparator() 
      void update(Command command) 
      void updateMenu(String title) 

    • Method Detail

      • addCommand

        void addCommand(Command command)
        This method will be called once for each command at present method in GuiController. At this point it is useful to create a map between the commands and the created GUI-objects for later update via update(Command).
        Parameters:
        command - The Command you have to add. The click action could be found at Command.getClickHandler().
        Note: Commands could contain sub commands. See: Command.getCommands().

      • update

        void update(Command command)
        Parameters:
        command - The Command to be updated. You have to update the GUI-object created by addCommand(Command).

      • updateMenu

        void updateMenu(String title)
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the whole menu

      • addSeparator

        void addSeparator()
